title: After Three Years on Mars, NASA's Ingenuity Helicopter Mission Ends
summary: NASA has proven powered, controlled flight is possible on other worlds, just as the Wright brothers proved it was possible on Earth.

title: The amazing helicopter on Mars, Ingenuity, will fly no more
summary: Ingenuity has spent more than two hours flying above Mars since April 2021.

title: After Three Years on Mars, NASA’s Ingenuity Helicopter Mission Ends
summary: NASA’s history-making Ingenuity Mars Helicopter has ended its mission at the Red Planet after surpassing expectations and making dozens more flights than planned. While the helicopter remains upright and in communication with ground controllers, imagery of its Jan. 18 flight sent to Earth this week indicates one or more of its rotor blades sustained damage during landing and it is no longer capable of flight.

title: Investing in Space: Sector led Lockheed and Northrop growth last year
summary: Typically, the quarterly reports of U.S. defense giants are a bit of a snooze for space sector watchers. While these companies have space divisions that bring in billions of revenue each year, and I dutifully check in each quarter to see how things are going, the defense primes’ leadership often treat space as a bit of an afterthought.

title: Not Invisible Anymore: Satellites reveal sources of atmospheric methane
summary: Satellites are playing a growing role in identifying methane sources at a time when the international community is focused on curbing emissions.
